definition: Rectification campaign/political purge/cf Mao's 1942-44 campaign at Yanan, and his 1950 and 1957 anti-rightist purges
exactly/in good order/whole/complete/entire/in order/orderly/to repair/to mend/to renovate/(coll.) to fix sb/to give sb a hard time/to mess with sb
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to move/to transport/to use/to apply/fortune/luck/fate
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: We are to carry out a rectification movement next year.
sentences.chinese: 我们准备在明年开展整风运动。

sentences.english: And rectification Movement is the concrete emancipation way.
sentences.chinese: 整风运动是解放思想的具体形式。

sentences.english: As this term of the Party School begins, the rectification movement is commencing throughout the Taihang area.
sentences.chinese: 在这次党校开学的同时，全太行区开始整风运动。

sentences.english: This was known as the Cheng Feng (Correct Wind) Movement.

definition: Rectification or Rectifying incorrect work styles, Maoist slogan/cf Rectification campaign 整風運動|整风运动, army purge of 1942-44 and anti-rightist purge of 1957
purge of counterrevolutionaries (esp. Mao's purge of hidden counterrevolutionaries 1955-56 and Stalin's Great Purge 1936-38)
to examine the cadres/same as 審查幹部|审查干部
Anti-Rightist Movement, Mao's purge of "rightists" after the Hundred Flowers Campaign ended in 1957
to eliminate counterrevolutionaries (abbr. for 肅清反革命份子|肃清反革命分子[su4 qing1 fan3 ge2 ming4 fen4 zi3])
anti-rightist/abbr. for 反右派鬥爭|反右派斗争[Fan3 you4 pai4 Dou4 zheng1]
the Four Cleanups Movement (1963-66), which aimed to cleanse the politics, economy, organization and ideology of the Communist Party
Anti-Rightist Movement, Mao's purge of "rightists" after the Hundred Flowers Campaign ended in 1957
to expose and criticize
Campaign to Suppress Counterrevolutionaries (PRC political campaign from 1950-1952), abbr. to 鎮反運動|镇反运动[Zhen4 fan3 Yun4 dong4]
pinyin: Zhen4 ya1 Fan3 ge2 ming4 Yun4 dong4

definition: Campaign to Suppress Counterrevolutionaries (PRC political campaign from 1950-1952), abbr. for 鎮壓反革命運動|镇压反革命运动[Zhen4 ya1 Fan3 ge2 ming4 Yun4 dong4]
factionalism/tribalism
Socialist Education Movement (1963-66), formal name of the Four Cleanups Movement 四清運動|四清运动[Si4 qing1 Yun4 dong4]
pinyin: She4 hui4 Zhu3 yi4 Jiao4 yu4 Yun4 dong4

definition: Gang of Four: Jiang Qing 江青, Zhang Chunqiao 張春橋, Yao Wenyuan 姚文元, Wang Hongwen 王洪文, who served as scapegoats for the excesses of the cultural revolution
struggle, criticize, and transform (Cultural Revolution catchcry)
sectarianism
